description: Amazon Linux 2 CIS Benchmark v3.0.0 - Section 5.2 Configure System Accounting (auditd)

controls.title: Ensure audit is installed
controls.description: auditd is the userspace component to the Linux Auditing System. It's responsible for writing audit records to the disk.
controls.remediation: Run the following command to install auditd: # yum install audit audit-libs

controls.title: Ensure auditing for processes that start prior to auditd is enabled
controls.description: Configure grub so that processes that are capable of being audited can be audited even if they start up prior to auditd startup.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/default/grub and add audit=1 to GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX. Then run: # grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/grub2/grub.cfg

controls.title: Ensure audit_backlog_limit is sufficient
controls.description: The backlog limit determines how many audit records can be queued. The default is 64, which may be insufficient for high-volume systems.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/default/grub and add audit_backlog_limit=8192 to GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX. Then run: # grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/grub2/grub.cfg

controls.title: Ensure auditd service is enabled
controls.description: Turn on the auditd daemon to record system events.
controls.remediation: Run the following command to enable auditd: # systemctl enable auditd

controls.title: Ensure audit log storage size is configured
controls.description: Configure the maximum size of the audit log file. Once the log reaches the maximum size, it will be rotated.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/audit/auditd.conf and set max_log_file = <appropriate_size>

controls.title: Ensure audit logs are not automatically deleted
controls.description: The max_log_file_action determines what happens when the log file reaches the maximum size. It should be set to keep_logs to prevent automatic deletion.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/audit/auditd.conf and set max_log_file_action = keep_logs

controls.title: Ensure system is disabled when audit logs are full
controls.description: The space_left_action parameter determines what happens when the system is running low on disk space.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/audit/auditd.conf and set space_left_action = email or space_left_action = syslog

controls.title: Ensure system warns when audit logs are low on space
controls.description: Configure system to warn when audit logs are low on space.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/audit/auditd.conf and set admin_space_left_action = single

controls.title: Ensure changes to system administration scope (sudoers) is collected
controls.description: Monitor changes to the sudoers file to detect unauthorized privilege escalation.
controls.remediation: Add the following line to /etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules: -w /etc/sudoers -p wa -k scope

controls.title: Ensure actions as another user are always logged
controls.description: Monitor actions performed by users with elevated privileges.
controls.remediation: Add the following line to /etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules: -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -C euid!=uid -F euid=0 -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged

controls.title: Ensure events that modify the sudo log file are collected
controls.description: Monitor changes to the sudo log file.
controls.remediation: Add the following line to /etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules: -w /var/log/sudo.log -p wa -k actions

controls.title: Ensure events that modify date and time information are collected
controls.description: Monitor changes to system time.
controls.remediation: Add audit rules for time modification: -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S adjtimex -S settimeofday -k time-change

controls.title: Ensure events that modify the system's network environment are collected
controls.description: Monitor changes to network configuration.
controls.remediation: Add audit rules for network changes: -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S sethostname -S setdomainname -k system-locale

controls.title: Ensure use of privileged commands are collected
controls.description: Monitor use of privileged commands.
controls.remediation: Add audit rules for privileged commands. For each privileged command, add: -a always,exit -F path=<command> -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged

controls.title: Ensure unsuccessful file access attempts are collected
controls.description: Monitor unsuccessful file access attempts.
controls.remediation: Add audit rules: -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S creat -S open -S openat -S truncate -S ftruncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access
controls.pattern: -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S creat -S open -S openat -S truncate -S ftruncate -F exit=-EACCES

controls.title: Ensure events that modify user/group information are collected
controls.description: Monitor changes to user and group information.
controls.remediation: Add audit rules: -w /etc/group -p wa -k identity -w /etc/passwd -p wa -k identity -w /etc/gshadow -p wa -k identity -w /etc/shadow -p wa -k identity

controls.title: Ensure discretionary access control permission modification events are collected
controls.description: Monitor changes to file permissions.
controls.remediation: Add audit rules: -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S chmod -S fchmod -S fchmodat -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

controls.title: Ensure successful file system mounts are collected
controls.description: Monitor file system mounts.
controls.remediation: Add audit rule: -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S mount -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k mounts

controls.title: Ensure session initiation information is collected
controls.description: Monitor session initiation.
controls.remediation: Add audit rules: -w /var/run/utmp -p wa -k session -w /var/log/wtmp -p wa -k logins -w /var/log/btmp -p wa -k logins

controls.title: Ensure login and logout events are collected
controls.description: Monitor login and logout events.
controls.remediation: Add audit rules: -w /var/log/faillog -p wa -k logins -w /var/log/lastlog -p wa -k logins

controls.title: Ensure file deletion events by users are collected
controls.description: Monitor file deletion events.
controls.remediation: Add audit rules: -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S unlink -S unlinkat -S rename -S renameat -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k delete
controls.pattern: -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S unlink -S unlinkat -S rename -S renameat

controls.title: Ensure events that modify the system's Mandatory Access Controls are collected
controls.description: Monitor changes to SELinux configuration.
controls.remediation: Add audit rule: -w /etc/selinux/ -p wa -k MAC-policy

controls.title: Ensure successful and unsuccessful attempts to use the chcon command are recorded
controls.description: Monitor use of the chcon command.
controls.remediation: Add audit rule: -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/chcon -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_chng

controls.title: Ensure successful and unsuccessful attempts to use the setfacl command are recorded
controls.description: Monitor use of the setfacl command.
controls.remediation: Add audit rule: -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/setfacl -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_chng

controls.title: Ensure successful and unsuccessful attempts to use the chacl command are recorded
controls.description: Monitor use of the chacl command.
controls.remediation: Add audit rule: -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/chacl -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_chng

controls.title: Ensure successful and unsuccessful attempts to use the usermod command are recorded
controls.description: Monitor use of the usermod command.
controls.remediation: Add audit rule: -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/usermod -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=4294967295 -k usermod

controls.title: Ensure kernel module loading unloading and modification is collected
controls.description: Monitor kernel module operations.
controls.remediation: Add audit rules: -w /sbin/insmod -p x -k modules -w /sbin/rmmod -p x -k modules -w /sbin/modprobe -p x -k modules

controls.title: Ensure the audit configuration is immutable
controls.description: Make the audit configuration immutable to prevent tampering.
controls.remediation: Add the following line to /etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules: -e 2

controls.title: Ensure the running and on disk configuration is the same
controls.description: Verify that the running audit configuration matches the on-disk configuration.
controls.remediation: Run: augenrules --load && systemctl restart auditd && auditctl -l

controls.title: Ensure the audit log directory is 0750 or more restrictive
controls.description: The audit log directory should have restrictive permissions.
controls.remediation: Run: chmod 750 /var/log/audit && chown root:root /var/log/audit

controls.title: Ensure audit log files are mode 0640 or less permissive
controls.description: Audit log files should have restrictive permissions.
controls.remediation: Run: find /var/log/audit -type f -exec chmod 640 {} \;

controls.title: Ensure only authorized users own audit log files
controls.description: Audit log files should be owned by root.
controls.remediation: Run: find /var/log/audit -type f -exec chown root {} \;

controls.title: Ensure only authorized groups are assigned ownership of audit log files
controls.description: Audit log files should belong to root group.
controls.remediation: Run: find /var/log/audit -type f -exec chgrp root {} \;

controls.title: Ensure audit configuration files are 640 or more restrictive
controls.description: Audit configuration files should have restrictive permissions.
controls.remediation: Run: find /etc/audit -type f -exec chmod 640 {} \;

controls.title: Ensure audit configuration files are owned by root
controls.description: Audit configuration files should be owned by root.
controls.remediation: Run: find /etc/audit -type f -exec chown root {} \;

controls.title: Ensure audit configuration files belong to group root
controls.description: Audit configuration files should belong to root group.
controls.remediation: Run: find /etc/audit -type f -exec chgrp root {} \;

controls.title: Ensure audit tools are 755 or more restrictive
controls.description: Audit tools should have appropriate permissions.
controls.remediation: Run: chmod 755 /usr/sbin/auditctl /usr/sbin/auditd /usr/sbin/aureport /usr/sbin/ausearch /usr/sbin/autrace /usr/sbin/audit-watch /usr/sbin/augenrules

controls.title: Ensure audit tools are owned by root
controls.description: Audit tools should be owned by root.
controls.remediation: Run: chown root:root /usr/sbin/auditctl /usr/sbin/auditd /usr/sbin/aureport /usr/sbin/ausearch /usr/sbin/autrace /usr/sbin/audit-watch /usr/sbin/augenrules

controls.title: Ensure audit tools belong to group root
controls.description: Audit tools should belong to root group.
controls.remediation: Run: chgrp root /usr/sbin/auditctl /usr/sbin/auditd /usr/sbin/aureport /usr/sbin/ausearch /usr/sbin/autrace /usr/sbin/audit-watch /usr/sbin/augenrules
